title: Rice weevil
subtitle: Sitophilus oryzae
desc: The insect attacks during spikelet stage of rice crop. Both nymphs and adults suck the content out of grains from pre-flowering spikelets to soft dough stage.

title: Gall Gnats
subtitle: Cecidomyiidae
desc: Gall midge maggot bore into bud or stalk of rice plant and feeds on internal content which leads to formation of tubular gall at the base of the tillers.

title: Whitebacked plant- hopper
subtitle: Sogatella furcifera
desc: White backed plant hopper is more abundant during the early stage of the growth of rice crop, especially in nurseries.

title: Mealybug
subtitle: Pseudococcidae
desc: The insect attacks during spikelet stage of rice crop. Both nymphs and adults suck the content out of grains from pre-flowering spikelets to soft dough stage.
